node.title: 'Absolutely extraordinary': Einstein's theory of relativity notes fetch $18 million at auction
node.alt: A paper manuscript with writing lays flat on a wooden table
node.description: Featuring endless calculations in black ink on wrinkled, lightly yellowed paper, the manuscript challenges Einstein's popular image as an absolute genius, because it shows that even he made mistakes.Â
node.content:
["A manuscript co-authored by Albert Einstein, offering a rare insight into the legendary physicist's thinking leading up to his general theory of relativity has sold at auction for 11.7 million euros ($18.2 million).", "Auction house\u00a0Christie's put the value of the manuscript at between two\u00a0and three million euros.", "The 54 pages of paper, half-filled with Einstein's handwriting, constituted one of only two working documents in which he approached\u00a0his famous theory.", "His theory of relativity laid the groundwork for modern cosmology, and technology\u00a0such as GPS navigation.", "The documents had been kept by Swiss physicist Michele Besso, a close friend and academic partner of Einstein's, who co-authored the work between 1913 and 1914.", "\"That's also what makes it particularly important given that working documents by Einstein before 1919 are extremely rare,\" auction expert Vincent Belloy said.\u00a0", "", "
Einstein's theory\u00a0of relativity laid the groundwork for modern cosmology and technology.\u00a0(Reuters: Antony Paone)
", "With endless\u00a0calculations in black ink on wrinkled, lightly yellowed paper, the manuscript challenged\u00a0Einstein's popular image as an absolute genius, because it showed\u00a0that even he made mistakes.", "\"Einstein makes errors in this manuscript, and that I think makes it even greater in a way, because we see the persistence, the thought that was in the process of being built, that is being corrected and redirected,\" Mr Belloy said.", "In May, a handwritten letter by Einstein, where he mentioned his famous E=mc\u00b2 equation, was sold at roughly one million euros in the United States, more than three times its estimated price.", "With his 1915 general theory of relativity, Einstein revolutionised modern physics when he first described gravitation as a geometric warping of space and time, a finding that remains valid.", "The auction house did not reveal the name of the buyer.\u00a0", "Reuters"]
